comment: Overall the course was only 'difficult' because of the amount of work given, but easy to get used to. Grade is based on discussions, quizzes, and tests. The quizzes usually only have a couple questions and the tests are usually 60~ questions. Both are decently a pain to study for. Make sure to be as neutral political wise in your discussion posts.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: If taken online, all course work is available to start. Six discussion posts- three paragraphs & four sentences each for initial and response, weekly textbook readings ~20-35 pgs., videos to watch ~25-30 min. & note taking is NOT necessary, & three exams but in my case only one used lockdown and the rest were open book/note and no webcam.

The material covered in this course was not very difficult. However, the way assignments are graded are not clear as to what she wants. Answers from the textbook are sometimes not even the correct answer for her. I have never in my life seen a more neglectful instructor at any level. She never answers Emails which is just confusing/unprofessional.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: I would rather retake Calc II or any other engineering class than hers. Her class was the most stressful, overwhelming, awful experience I went through in college. She is rude and condescending in emails, and forces you to choose a republican or democrat side in a class competition/project. Avoid at all costs, find literally anyone else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Very test heavy, and the tests are particularly hard and long, 65 questions. I found it difficult to get email responses from her and the homework was a lot each week and I didn't feel like I had time to study for exams. Lastly, she does drop your two lowest grades for discussion posts, and video quizzes however I would not recommend this prof.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This class was easy in terms of quizzes and workload. You will have two assignments due every week, one on Monday and one on Wednesday. You will have a discussion post once a month. All tests are lockdown browser. Doesn't respond to emails and when she does it is rude and not helpful. Overall would take class again based off of workload.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Not accessible outside of class and takes a while to respond to emails. Doesn't make information easily accessible or known but gets annoyed if you ask. Mostly textbook work, but has a lot of different deadlines so it can be difficult to keep track of what assignements are due when and often have three things due on seperate days every week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER!!! 90% of the study guide will NOT be on the exam (lockdown). She doesn't respond to emails even about assignments that don't have proper direction. She gives homework like you're only taking one class. Definitely a GPA buster. I dropped to protect my GPA. American Government should not be this hard!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I highly recommend that you choose a different professor. She does not give any extra credit assignment and does not except late work no matter the reason. The exam consist of questions that we did not even learn about. She assigns quizzes that are not answer specific and she is rude.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: He test are absurd. 65 questions of specific details with closed note and lock down browser. Does not communicate well with students. Would not recommend at all.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy

comment: Three tests are 55% of your grade and each one covers 4 chapters.  I studied for a full week and memorized all of the key terms and everything from her study guide and got a 70 on the first test.  Lockdown browser and definitely not open notes. She asked minute details that weren't on the study guide and definitely weren't key terms.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: She is one of the worst professors I have ever had. She is extremely rude and disrespectful if you email her and probably wont respond to any in the first place. Class is lecture and reading heavy and her exams are extremely difficult. No credit replacement opportunity and is overall a tough grader. DONT TAKE HER PLEASE
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This online class is very organized and set up so I knew what was due when. Same thing every week textbook reading, discussion post and 3 open note exams. So easy A if you actually do the work and read the book.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. Aggressive in emails / just won't respond. Lots of errors in her quizzes/assignments and she won't change them even if she was in the wrong. 3 exams are worth 60% of your grade (lockdown) and gives you less than a min and a half per question. Her class is a mess overall and she doesn't care about her online class. 4+ quizzes a week
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: This professor showed us unwarranted images of aborted babies that were un-alive. Pushing her obvious stance of being against abortion on the whole class. She literally just popped the images on screen without any warning. I feel bad for any women that might have been triggered.

2 discussion posts (3 paragraphs each), one chapter (6ish quizzes, 15ish pages per), video lecture/quiz due per week. Two attempts on exams, but grades the average of the two instead of the highest score. Disrespectful/rude in emails. Group project that lasts a month and can require over 10hrs of work per week. Do not recommend, not worth it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Luckow is a great teacher & she tries to make her classes interesting and engaging, & she is an interesting and engaging class. Showing up is a solid portion of your grade, & while she is a great teacher, she uses a textbook platform for homework that takes a LOT of time & energy on the student's end. Only take her if you have the time and energy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: The lectures in class are mandatory, however they just review what the textbook readings discussed. There is a group project at the end of the semester worth 15% of your grade. There is no final exam just another regular test, however all 3 tests add up to 55% of your grade. She is relatable and non-threatening, really cares about you as a student.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: She doesn't assign a lot of homework (usually one chapter reading a week) and her class activities are always super fun. She does one group project at the end of the course, (individually graded) but she helps where she can, and always gives good feedback. Her exams are easy to pass if you do the readings and attend her jeopardy review. Loved it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Luckow is amazing. Her lectures are fun and we get to debate a lot of topics. She does require online textbook with weekly reading quizzes, but this helps you study for the exams. Exams are hard but she gives a study guide and does an online review before the exam. She is super passionate and funny!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Weekly homework from the textbook is assigned each week. Test is basically straight from the textbook, so reading the textbook is very important. Nothing from the lectures is on the test, but lectures are interesting. Group project at the end of the semester which isn't too difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I would never take a class by this professor again. She is completely disorganized here expectations are not clear at all. Most of the time you have to ask her what her directions means because they just don't make sense. The project at the end of the semester is a joke. If you end up on the republican side of the project good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Group projects

comment: She's pretty nice, but the class is not. The tests are not to be underestimated, I bombed multiple tests and still did better than a lot of people in the class. The campaign project saved my butt. Weekly reading on Revel. STUDY FOR THE TESTS. Trust me, these are not tests that you can cram for an hour and pass. Read and study. I am lucky I got a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Didn't really pay attention to her lectures as most of the topics on the study guides were in the textbook. Need to always check into iClicker. She was actually pretty politically neutral imo, pointing out different sides of topics- the good and bad. The campaign project is where she was a little disorganized but she is always looking for feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Absolutely terrible class. She is very unorganized and tuff to keep up with in her lectures. Her lectures are absolutely irrelevant to the content and if you dont study the textbook you will fail. I do not recommend her at all.

I took this class in Fall2020 as a dual enrolment student. It was very heavy on info. Absolutely no respect towards her students. She has class but they are optional. Doesn't understand students have a life. On a Saturday she gave 30min notice to a class. She also scheduled the final for a weekend. Got my first ever C because she was not helpful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: She is down to earth but can be passive aggressive. Her global issues class requires an online textbook but its cheap. Class has 4 tests, case study, one group presents every week, and weekly quizzes based off every chapter. Test impacts grade the most. Her class was fun and easy and she's down to play among us. Grades attendance and participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Luckow was okay. Tests were pretty difficult unless you study for hours. I barely made an A in this class. If you take her, make sure to complete everything she assigns or you will not pass the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Professor Luckow was my favorite professor this semester! She really made online learning as easy and fun as it could be, and you could tell she really cared about us and how we were doing in the class. There's a quiz on the textbook chapter every week and one group project that isn't too bad, she helps guide you through it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Caring

comment: Professor Luckow is one of my favorite instructors, not only does she make the course material interesting but she makes it relevant and considerably enjoyable. Her personality is awesome and she actually gives you tips on effective studying. If you can, take her class and promise your GPA will thank you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: You get the grade you earn in this class. I felt all of the tests were easy if you did your work but some people in my class struggled. You have to work with a group for the entire semester so if you don't like group projects then don't take her. She can be a really hard grader but she is fair.
rating_tags: Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Great professor and certainly an enjoyable class. As long as you stay on top of your weekly reading from the text books, you will do well in class. Lectures are great for providing more depth to what you read in the book, but DO NOT rely on lectures alone to pass. You should spend around 2 hours per chapter taking notes. Good luck!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: She is a very energetic person who has some pretty entertaining lectures sometimes however her notes are completely useless which leaves you with an lack luster long boring textbook that you have to rely on her tests are extremely misleading do not take her if your taking the class only for the credit
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Hilarious

comment: A decent choice for POLS 1101, but do not take her for other classes. Very opinionated and can sometimes be a bit extreme. She regularly made the class debate with each other over issues like drug addicts and abortions, which I thought was fun. You can get a B with a little effort but an A can be difficult for most. A very interesting class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Many of these reviews are for her POLS 1101 class, however I took her 3313. This review is coming from someone that attended every class, read every chapter, and did all assignments. She is a HARSH grader, and a tough person to deal with in general. YOU HAVE TO WRITE A 13 + PAGE PAPER AND SHE GRADES IT HARSHLY. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Luckow was an overall great professor. She was hilarious and there was almost never a boring class. Just make sure to come to class and do the work she assigns and youll do fine!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Pretty cool and funny professor. As long as you do your textbook reading and quizzes every week and listen/take notes during her lectures you'll do fine! Didn't study too much for test and still got A's on them. There is a big group project at the end but it wasn't too much work and was all done in class. Would recommend if you need to take gov.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Luckow knows what she's doing. Although her class is difficult, it is not impossible. Her tests definitely require studying. There are assignments due weekly on the online textbook, and she checks attendance (which is 15% of grade) with an app. She is very funny and makes the lectures interesting. I recommend her class if you want to learn.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Most fun and interesting professor I've had so far after four semesters. The class was (surprisingly) interesting too, given I don't like politics. Loves to digress into stories from her college years. The group projects are not one of her better ideas. Test answers come mostly from textbook/Constitution, but some are also from lecture notes.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: This class was ohkay. The test are challenging and there is homework due every weekend online. Her lectures are ohkay, they are a bit boring at times. There is a lot of class interaction during lecture, which makes it interesting. It is easy to fail this class. And attendance is mandatory and will affect your grade at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The test were very hard. I usually always get As and Bs but I had no understanding of government.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Luckow is by far the worst professor that I have ever had in my college career. She is terrible at lecturing and she expects you to be able to learn and understand the material on your own just by reading the book. Hood luck if you get her as a professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a super nice person and cares about the topic. But everything on the test are things you learn from the book, the actual class has nothing to do with the test. Taking this class requires more attention than I had time to give. Only take this class if you have the time to do well
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Good teacher and very funny! Tests are somewhat difficult, but if you do the online assignments and read the textbook you should do fine. Group project is not the best. Attendance is mandatory!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Super hard tests and group project sucked, but she's an amazing person/teacher
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Great teacher, but tough class. Make sure you read and make study groups. Graded by three tests and a project. Show up to every class to help your grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She was very nice and the lectures were entertaining. Read the book and you will do fine on the tests. Final project was extremely fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: Such an amazing person. Her lectures are super entertaining and although I did not end up with the best grade in her class, I know what to do next time. READ YOUR TEXTBOOK and go to class. Her tests are tricky but not impossible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She's a great person and having her as a teacher was fun. Her tests are extremely hard and if you don't read and study then you won't pass. She teaches well though so pay attention and take notes while in class. She's funny and makes the lectures much more enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Luckow is an amazing professor. She knows her material well, but will make you work for an A. The textbook isn't the best and can be hard to understand. AVOID taking this class on one day. (Friday only, ect.). The readings and homework quizzes can get overwhelming if you don't keep at it. An A is doable, you just have to work for it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: she's super funny but the tests are really hard and don't exactly go along with the chapters sometimes
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Lots of content to cover and overall is a good class. Tests are super hard so studying is a must. The teacher is super nice and is open-minded. However, she has a group project at the end that's a pain in the neck. Not hard just super time-consuming right when studying for finals begins. Overall Pleased. Attendance is a part of the grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is a straight forward professor. However, I have noticed that she is very understanding if needed. She gave a chapter to read every week, and the reading is not rigorous. The reading is merely just a few pages in an online textbook. The material is not that difficult to comprehend. She also uses real world applications in her lesson. Take her
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I did very well in my AP gov class in high school, so this class was a bit of a breeze, she definitely cares about her students. If you skip youll fail. The study guides are very vague and you really have to study broadly for her tests, but you always know exactly which chapters the tests will be on. The first test was the easiest, the rest are eh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: It's an entertaining-ish class, I just wish she would teach the material. If I had known that I was going to be teaching myself, I would have just taken it online. Hated the campaign project at the end of the class. Final is simple. Weekly quizzes in Revel. Expects participation. First two tests are difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Her lectures are a bit stale, but her tangents can kind of get her rolling and it's enjoyable. She's very open-minded and doesn't have a filter at times, which is great from an entertainment aspect. Bunch of online readings, but, external resources are always key, *cough* Google. Tests are like the study guides she gives, sorta. Final was matching.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Ms. Luckow's class is fun. You don't have to come to class, but I did b/c I wanted an A and I pay to go. ALSO, attendance & participation counts (10% learning catalytics). 3 tests  worth 60%. 20% online Revel book w/ weekly readings and quizzes. 10% Campaign project at the end of the semester (choose group wisely). Have a study group! Points count
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Online class, Easy A
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Veronica Vaughn Luckow! was awesome the class is simple... do the weekly assignment study the study guide for the exams and you will walk out with an A. Her lectures are fun and interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: She is very nice and makes class enjoyable, however lectures don't help retain information. That being said if you do the weekly reading and homework you can consistently do well on her tests
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: SHE IS A HORRIBLE TEACHER (IF YOU EVEN WANT TO CONSIDER HER A TEACHER) She gave a group assignment that I got 100 on, but since one group member didn't submit an evaluation form she took away my 100 (and the rest of the groups) and gave us ZEROS until that person submitted that part.  Everyone deserves better as well as you so don't take it....
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Her class is simple and easy to pass. Do the weekly homework on Sunday's and listen in class you should do fine. There are 3 tests including the final and a easy project. She is very nice and tried to make the class enjoyable. If you're worried about political beliefs interfering with yours, she is an independent so generally sees both sides
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: test are super hard, she's a terrible teacher. verges way off topic in lectures and test you on entirely different material from the books. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I loved Professor Luckow as a person but not as a professor. Majority of class was her going on a tangent about stuff not even pertaining to what the reading was assigned to. She's funny but it was frustrating to feel like I was teaching myself the material. Attendance is mandatory and counts for a lot on your final grade. Easy class to pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I absolutely LOVED her class. I got lucky and took POLS during an election, and it has been an amazing experience. She's got a great sense of humor, and the group project was fun. Tests are all multiple choice and easy if you study. participation is from a phone app, which I loved also. TopHat is great.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: You honestly don't learn anything from the lectures and class itself because she will go on random tangents that have nothing to do with the chapter. However, attendance is mandatory and counts for a pretty significant part of the grade. There's quizzes due every week, but they're extremely easy, just time consuming. The exams are HARD!

you go to class and lecture with your classmates about stuff completely irrelevant to the chapter you are studying. the only thing she really gives you to study with for the exams is her revel quizzes. huge group project at the end of the semester which is easy. two of her exams were online but still tough, and overall everything requires effort

Weekly online quizzes that are factored into your grade. 3 tests that you MUST study for or you will not pass. She does participation points in class that can really help your grade if you're there and really hurt it if you're not. Reading the book and studying is essential because she only covers part of the content in class.

Luckow is a good teacher, does not take your crap though. Grade is made up of participation, she uses an app for this, online quizzes due every sunday, 3 tests and 1 group project. The campaign project was my favorite part of the class and definitely the best part.

This class isn't hard at all really just expect to do a lot of online textbook assignments. If you do all these an A is in reach for you, however you will have 3 test on that material. You don't learn much in class, but you debt a lot about issues which is fun. Also you can only miss 3 classes before your grade drops!

This wasn't a class that I enjoyed; however, it wasn't terrible either. We had 3 tests (kind of difficult) and weekly quizzes online (super easy). We also used tophat for class participation. I received an A in this class , but I can't say that I learned anything or retained information. The group project was pretty easy also, all in class.

The class grades are broken down into weekly online quizzes, 3 test, participation/attendance, and a group project. Expect to have an online quiz due every week but they are easy and the answers can be found on Quizlet. Our class lucked out on the test because she gave two of our test online but don't expect her to do that with your class.
